log.content: Create me a website about 3d printers. Make it technical and informative, including information such as calibration, what process should be followed after changing filament etc. Add lots of detail and use a modern design language with the main color being orange. You should create multiple pages, but make sure the main page is available in index.html

function.name: create_file
create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"index.html","content":" 3D Printer Technical Guide

3D Printer Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Guide

Welcome to the 3D Printing Technical Hub

This site provides detailed technical guidance for 3D printer users, focusing on calibration, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Explore the navigation links above to access comprehensive guides.

Key topics include:

  • Printer bed leveling and Z-axis calibration
  • Extruder temperature and filament flow optimization
  • Post-filament-change procedures to prevent nozzle clogs
  • Layer adhesion adjustments
Get Started with Calibration

© 2024 3D Printer Technical Guide

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"calibration.html","content":" 3D Printer Calibration Guide

3D Printer Calibration Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Guide

Step-by-Step Calibration Procedures

Bed Leveling

  1. Home the printer using G28
  2. Use manual adjusters or BLTouch to level the bed
  3. Verify with a piece of paper between nozzle and bed

Z-Offset Adjustment

  1. Print a test cube at 0.3mm layer height
  2. Measure cube height with calipers
  3. Adjust Z-axis using M295 command if discrepancy exists

Extruder Calibration

  1. Extrude 100mm filament using G1 E100 F50
  2. Measure actual extruded length
  3. Adjust steps/mm in firmware if discrepancy >2%
Back to Home

© 2024 3D Printer Technical Guide

"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"filename":"filament_change.html","content":" Filament Change Guide

Filament Change Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change Guide

Procedure After Changing Filament

Steps for PLA Filament

  1. Preheat nozzle to filament temperature (PLA: 190-220°C)
  2. Unload old filament via printer menu or G10 command
  3. Load new filament by pushing through Bowden tube/nozzle
  4. Purge 10-15cm filament into waste container
  5. Check first layer adhesion after purging

Advanced Tips

  • For PETG/ABS: Increase temperature by 5-10°C when switching
  • Clean nozzle with a brass brush if backpressure occurs
  • Check filament diameter consistency (±0.05mm tolerance)
Back to Home

© 2024 3D Printer Technical Guide

"}
